N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 30.8 - Monthly report

State Regulations
(a) Every
licensee shall submit a monthly report to the commissioner, which shall be made
on forms provided by the commissioner and shall contain the following
information: (1)
the total number of barrels
of petroleum transferred to the licensee's major facility during the previous
month; (2)
the total number of
barrels of petroleum transferred to the licensee's major facility during the
previous month that had previously been transferred and subject to fee
imposition; and
(3)
such other
information as is required by the department for the proper and effective
administration of article 12 of the Navigation Law. (b) All monthly reports shall contain the
sworn statement of an owner or operator of the major facility, or of an
authorized officer or employee of the owner or operator of the major facility, that the facts stated in the monthly report are true to the best of such
person's knowledge and belief. (c) Monthly reports shall be submitted to the commissioner at the following
address: Major Petroleum Facilities Section

Accounting and Fiscal Services Bureau

New York State Department of Transportation
1220 Washington Avenue

Building 5, State Campus

Albany, New York 12232
(d) The monthly report for each month shall
be received by the commissioner no later than the 20th day of the month
immediately following. Any monthly report mailed to the commissioner must be
properly addressed and postage paid. If a monthly report is mailed and is not
delivered by the United States mail to the Major Petroleum Facilities Section
by the 20th day of the month immediately following, the date of United States
postmark stamped on the envelope shall be deemed to be the date of receipt by
the commissioner. Notes
